title: yoshichika takagi carves house-shaped volume out of japanese residence
text:
yoshichika takagi carves house-shaped volume out of japanese residence feb 22, 2017 yoshichika takagi carves house-shaped volume out of japanese residence 

challenged with an irregular triangular and sloping site outside of the city of sapporo in japan , ‘house in nishino’ is a project completed by yoshichika takagi + associates . to reduce the overall budget of the construction of the family home, the excavation process was small and instead, the architects exploited the building’s height and added a second level. 
the site has irregular triangle shape and 4 meter height difference from one edge to the other 


the envelope of the dwelling uses timber wood panels and at its core, a house-shaped volume clad in polycarbonate panels interrupts the wood façade. this feature was yoshichika takagi ’s response in providing a comfortable space for the family to tackle hokkaido’s harsh winters. inside, this floor-to-ceiling house-shaped volume serves as a warm internal courtyard due to its greenhouse effect. a single small tree has been planted in the center and the transparency of each side diffuses natural light into this communal area of the home. 
natural light bathes the dining room in the central courtyard space 


the other programs are organized around the center space and are never really closed off; even the spaces upstairs. the walls of the second level are slightly tilted to follow the gabled roof of the house-shaped void to encourage air flow and simultaneously, gives the impression of a larger floor-plan. in turn, each of the rooms open and face into this courtyard, allowing an even distribution of natural light without the need of many windows on the exterior façade. 
rooms all face into the house-shaped void 
the architect 
the architects inserted this space as a place of warmth during the harsh winter’s in hokkaido 
the kitchen 
a small plant sits at the center of the greenhouse-courtyard 
the same materials is used throughout the two floors 
the communal programs are located on the ground floor 
the house is located in a residential area where it is rich in nature and close to the center of sapporo
